data.title: Introduce atom.directory-provider service.
data.body:
A `Project` will always have a `DefaultDirectoryProvider` that
will be used if there are no other `DirectoryProvider` objects
that can produce a `Directory` for a path.

data.title: Optimize auto-indent on paste
data.body:
Previously, auto-indent-on-paste updated pasted text _after_ inserting it into the buffer, causing tons of buffer changes events to be emitted, which is very expensive. Now, we adjust all but the first line of the inserted text before inserting it into the buffer. The first line still needs to be post-processed in case it requires indentation to be less than the insertion column.

Fixes #5529
Fixes #5411

data.title: Project::setPaths() can hose a project
data.body:
If you use `Project::setPaths()` to change the tree in a project to the wrong folder and close atom, then that is serialized and every time you try to open the project you get that wrong tree loaded.  That folder is then unaccessible until you clear out `~/.atom/storage`.  This was very frustrating.  I had to work on that folder with notepad++ until @lee-dohm told me about the storage folder.

See https://github.com/JavascriptIsMagic/tree-view-git-projects/issues/2 and https://discuss.atom.io/t/atom-opening-wrong-folder/14882.

windows 8.1
atom 0.177.0 (and older)

FYI: This is not a new problem.

data.title: [PHP] Syntax highlighting for inline variables
data.body:
![Issue example](http://i.imgur.com/lzUxSyj.png)

As shown in the image, OO style function calls surrounded by curly braces in strings doesn't format properly.

data.title: Update.exe chewing CPU
data.body:
Hi, it seems most mornings Atom's `Update.exe` process consumes a lot of CPU - up to 80%, for several minutes, before settling down to use ~5% for several minutes.  This seems like a lot when Atom is already up to date on my PC, so there are no updates to install / process.

Is this expected?  If not, I'll be a bit more attentive to its actual behaviour, and see if I can provide a more detailed report.

Thanks.

data.title: Pasting large amounts of text has gotten really slow
data.body:
Here I'm pasting ~800 lines of text and it's taking about 100ms. Looks like we're spending a ton of time in `setIndentationForBufferRow`, probably because the presenter is doing more work synchronously in these cases. @maxbrunsfeld do you think we could auto-indent before inserting the text to avoid this? 

![screenshot 2015-02-12 13 31 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1789/6176352/7cf95832-b2bb-11e4-8bad-cedddea054ab.png)

Sync vs async presenter updates is a tricky balancing act because async will be slower in extremely common cases such as inserting a character but faster in less common ones like indenting 800 lines. I may need to revisit my approach and do more of the presenter work async.

data.title: :memo: a little hint added for 'Building from source for linux'
data.body:
_script/build_ has the shebang #!/usr/bin/env node. On some system this command is no available but nodejs (e.g. on debian).
The softlink fixes this problem, and all the other steps work fine.

data.title: Move reactCompat option to transform as per 6to5 deprecation warning.
data.body:
Bumped the version of 6to5-core to `^3.6.0` to ensure `reactCompat` is
available as a transform rather than an option.

Verified that the deprecation warning went away in my console and that a
package that uses JSX+React still works as expected.

data.title: Deprecations in Tasks aren't reported
data.body: If you have code running inside a `Task` handler, then any deprecations encountered in there won't be reported to deprecation cop since they happen out of process.

data.title: Minimize CoffeeScript requires
data.body:
This PR does several things related to deferring and minimizing the CoffeeScript compiles done at startup.
- [x] Extract `coffee-cache` into a separate lib.
  - This allows it to be more easily setup as early as possible without concerns for being in dev mode.
- [x] Don't require CoffeeScript until the first `.coffee` file is required.
  - This saves `~50ms` on startup when all CoffeeScript files are cached or no `.coffee` files are required.
- [x] Cache generated source maps to disk.
  - Dev mode is slow because `coffeestack` is used to convert stack traces and so it was compiling CoffeeScript files on startup for any deprecated calls. coffeestack now caches source maps to disk so that compiles won't be needed in between launches.  This dropped dev mode load time from 2 seconds to 1 second for me.

data.title: List installed packages and themes
data.body: I know Atom takes care of detecting pending updates for installed packages and themes and notifying me, but I can't seem to find where in the settings I can simply view all my installed packages and themes.  Can you point me in the right direction?

data.title: Return pane items from the config opener, rather than using workspace.open
data.body: This way, options like `split: ‘left’` can be used with the config URIs.

data.title: Saving message would be nice
data.body:
When I use Atom with mounted (S)FTP disks that are slow and I save the editor is not responsive until the file is saved. Would be nice to have a notification or something that tells me that the file is still saving.

Thanks

data.title: Optimize TextEditorPresenter
data.body: This avoids a bunch of redundant synchronous computation in the presenter. For a single character input, it reduces the time spent updating the presenter synchronously by about .6 ms.

data.title: Ability to see the warning when build aborts
data.body: It would be very useful for a user and probably to help debug for you guys to have the Warnings display in the terminal instead of just saying "Aborted due to warnings.". I then have to modify my build script to use `-v` so I can see the warning.

data.title: UTF-16LE file is opened with UTF-8 and only 7-bit ASCII characters are correctly decoded
data.body:
When I open files of UTF-16LE, ATOM magically decodes only 7-bit ASCII characters but no other characters are decoded. I think there are many \0 characters on the file so that ATOM can detect UTF-16 in better way.
Furthermore, even with UTF-16LE files with BOM could not be loaded correctly :(

data.title: Allow starring of community packages in installed list
data.body:
Allow toggling of whether a package is starred on atom.io from inside Atom.

This eases the install of Atom on other computers by using `apm stars --install`.

data.title: Open Recent Missing
data.body: It would be a good enhancement to have a 'Open Recent' on the File Menu, like in Sublime.

data.title: Package: The tern dependency range in the package.json file is invalid:
data.body: I used to get a dependency for a package i'm working on via "tern": "git://github.com/marijnh/tern.git" There seems to be no way since 0.177 to publish a package with this type of dependency. The tern dependency range in the package.json file is invalid: git://github.com/marijnh/tern Per design or issue? thx tststs

data.title: ~/.atom has to be created with permissions for all users on ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
I am not shure if this is an apm issue or an atom issue in general but here is what happens if 

``` Shell
~/.atom
```

is not set with rwrwrw

![result of compiling atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5676367/6164795/b2e1869a-b2a2-11e4-9929-ee7206c8a3a6.PNG)

this is easy to fix by entering chmod 777 ~/.atom

but the directory should have this permissions right after building the editor or when installing the deb package to avoid this issue

---

This should be added to the trooubleshooting section of 

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md

data.title: Command to close all tabs
data.body:
Any specific reason why such a common command across editors is not available in Atom?

I implemented it like this and it works just fine (respects other open projects a well as files with unsaved changes):

`atom.workspace.getPanes()[0].destroy()`

The keybinding from Textmate 1 (cmd-ctrl-w) is free by default.

Cheers - Victor
